Technique: DOVETAIL (JOINT); WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek papyrus
Description: This fragment of papyrus (P. Oxy. III 573), which comes from the town of Oxyrhynchus and which dates from the 3rd century of our era, belongs to a recycled "volumen" , made from scraps of expired documents. Three of them are visible on the recto of the fragment. It contains the verses 452-471 of the 19th ode of the "Odyssey", the second epic of Homer.
